title: Relates to prohibiting certain candidates for public office from serving as poll watchers
summary: Relates to prohibiting certain candidates for public office from serving as poll watchers.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1547

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. MILLMAN -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Election Law

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to poll watchers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  4  of  section 8-500 of the election law, as
    2  amended by chapter 9 of the laws of 1978, is amended to read as follows:
    3    4. Each watcher must be a qualified voter of the  city  or  county  in
    4  which  he  OR SHE is to serve.  NO PERSON SHALL BE APPOINTED OR ACT AS A
    5  WATCHER WHO IS A CANDIDATE FOR ANY PUBLIC OFFICE TO BE VOTED FOR BY  THE
    6  VOTERS OF THE DISTRICT IN WHICH THE WATCHER IS TO SERVE.
    7    S2. This act shall take effect immediately.







        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04942-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to poll watchers
